t: Psalm 33
Praise to the Creator
Rejoice*pn in the Lord,*s you righteous ones; praise*ln from the upright is beautiful.
Praise*ln the Lord*s with the lyre; make*ln music to him with a ten-stringed harp.
Sing*ln a new song to him; play*ln skillfully on the strings, with a joyful shout.
For*pn the word of the Lord*s is right, and*ln all his work is trustworthy.
He*ln loves righteousness and justice; the*ln earth is full of the Lord’s*s unfailing love.
The*pn heavens were made by the word of the Lord,*s and*ln all the stars, by the breath of his mouth.
He*ln gathers the water of the sea into a heap; he*ln puts the depths into storehouses.
Let*ln the whole earth fear the Lord;*s let*ln all the inhabitants of the world stand in awe of him.
For*ln he spoke, and it came into being; he*ln commanded, and it came into existence.
The*pn Lord*s frustrates the counsel of the nations; he*ln thwarts the plans of the peoples.
The*ln counsel of the Lord*s stands forever, the*ln plans of his heart from generation to generation.
Happy*ln is the nation whose God is the Lord—*s the*ln people he has chosen to be his own possession!
The*pn Lord*s looks down from heaven; he*ln observes everyone.
He*ln gazes on all the inhabitants of the earth from*ln his dwelling place.
He*ln forms the hearts of them all; he*ln considers all their works.
A*ln king is not saved by a large army; a*ln warrior will not be rescued by great strength.
The*ln horse is a false hope for safety; it*ln provides no escape by its great power.
But*pn look, the Lord*s keeps his eye on those who fear him — those*ln who depend on his faithful love
to*ln rescue them from death and*ln to keep them alive in famine.
We*pn wait for the Lord;*s he*ln is our help and shield.
For*ln our hearts rejoice in him because*ln we trust in his holy name.
May*ln your faithful love rest on us, Lord,*s for*ln we put our hope in you.
